intro: Cheiranthus sinuatus, commonly known as the Sinuous honesty, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, white or pale purple flowers and linear, sinuous leaves that give it its common name. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its seeds are small and contained in a siliqua, a type of dry, dehiscent fruit typical of the Brassicaceae family.
